documentation.text: @dev Deposits stake for a client allowing the client to submit block headers.

@dev Withdraws the stake of a client. The stake is reduced by the specified amount. Emits an event WithdrawStake
      containing the client's address and the amount of withdrawn stake.

documentation.text:
@dev Checks for each block referenced in blocksSubmittedByClient whether it is unlocked. In case a referenced
      block's lock period has expired, its reference is removed from the list blocksSubmittedByClient.

attributes.text:
@dev Checks for each block referenced in blocksSubmittedByClient whether it is unlocked. In case a referenced
      block's lock period has expired, its reference is removed from the list blocksSubmittedByClient.

devdoc.author: Marten Sigwart, Philipp Frauenthaler, Leonhard Esterbauer, Markus Levonyak
devdoc.details: This contract uses the EthrelayCore contract and extends it with an incentive structure.

depositStake(uint256).details: Deposits stake for a client allowing the client to submit block headers.

verifyReceipt(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes,.details: Verifies if a receipt is included in the given block's receipts Merkle Patricia trie

params.feeInWei: the fee that is payed for the verification and must be equal to VERIFICATION_FEE_IN_WEI.
params.noOfConfirmations: the required number of succeeding blocks needed for a block to be considered as confirmed
params.path: the path (key) in the trie indicating the way starting at the root node and ending at the receipt
params.rlpEncodedNodes: an RLP encoded list of nodes of the Merkle branch, first element is the root node, last element the receipt
params.rlpEncodedReceipt: the receipt of the Merkle Patricia trie in RLP format
params.rlpHeader: the rlp encoded header that contains the Merkle root hash

returns._0: 0: verification was successful         1: block is confirmed and unlocked, but the Merkle proof was invalid

verifyState(uint256,bytes,uint8,bytes,by.details: Verifies if a node is included in the given block's state Merkle Patricia trie

params.feeInWei: the fee that is payed for the verification and must be equal to VERIFICATION_FEE_IN_WEI.
params.noOfConfirmations: the required number of succeeding blocks needed for a block to be considered as confirmed
params.path: the path (key) in the trie indicating the way starting at the root node and ending at the node
params.rlpEncodedNodes: an RLP encoded list of nodes of the Merkle branch, first element is the root node, last element a state node
params.rlpEncodedState: the node of the Merkle Patricia trie in RLP format
params.rlpHeader: the rlp encoded header that contains the Merkle root hash

returns._0: 0: verification was successful         1: block is confirmed and unlocked, but the Merkle proof was invalid

verifyTransaction(uint256,bytes,uint8,by.details: Verifies if a transaction is included in the given block's transactions Merkle Patricia trie

params.feeInWei: the fee that is payed for the verification and must be equal to VERIFICATION_FEE_IN_WEI.
params.noOfConfirmations: the required number of succeeding blocks needed for a block to be considered as confirmed
params.path: the path (key) in the trie indicating the way starting at the root node and ending at the transaction
params.rlpEncodedNodes: an RLP encoded list of nodes of the Merkle branch, first element is the root node, last element the transaction
params.rlpEncodedTx: the transaction of the Merkle Patricia trie in RLP format
params.rlpHeader: the rlp encoded header that contains the Merkle root hash

returns._0: 0: verification was successful         1: block is confirmed and unlocked, but the Merkle proof was invalid

withdrawStake(uint256).details: Withdraws the stake of a client. The stake is reduced by the specified amount. Emits an event WithdrawStake      containing the client's address and the amount of withdrawn stake.

devdoc.title: Ethrelay: A contract enabling cross-blockchain verifications (transactions, receipts, states)

userdoc.notice: You can use this contract for submitting new block headers, disputing already submitted block headers, and         for verifying Merkle Patricia proofs (transactions, receipts, states).
